alert.note: Alert for Central Coast Range of Western Oregon (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 4:38PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN LANE COUNTY THROUGH 515 PM PDT... At 437 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Triangle Lake, or 20 miles west of Eugene, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Triangle Lake, Swisshome, Greenleaf, Noti, Deadwood, and Blachly. In Oregon this includes State Highway 126 west of Eugene between mile markers 34 and 41. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If on or near Triangle Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Central Coast Range of Western Oregon
